coin.sc_launched: This contract has launched been launched
coin.blockchain_launched: This blockchain has been launched (genesis block has been mined)
coin.add_algo: Your algorithm is not here? Add it.
coin.replay_protection: Does this fork have two-way replay protection?
coin.premine_error: Please enter a valid premibe amount
coin.max_coins_error: Please enter a valid max coin amount
coin.git_repo: GitHub repository for main node software
coin.sc_url: What is the smart contract URL
coin.additional_info: You can add a message here and it will be seen by the person responsible for fact-checking and approval.
coin.currency_name_info: Please input the name of the cryptocurrency, token, ICO, etc.
coin.currency_symbol_info: Please input the symbol for this currency.
coin.ico_info: How much was raised in total, including all rounds and pre-sales etc?
coin.genesis_info: When was the genesis block mined? The easiest way to check this is to seach on Google for a block explorer for this blockchain and go to block 0. In most block explorers you can simply type "0" into their search feature and it will find the genesis block. In some cases, the genesis block may have a unix timestamp of "0" which translates to 1st January 1970. In those cases, simply use block 1 instead.
coin.launch_info: When do the people behind this coin intend to mine the genesis block or launch the coin?
coin.fork_info: Please select which Bitcoin blockchain this fork is forking from. For example if it is a fork of Bitcoin Cash, simply choose "Bitcoin Cash".
coin.fork_height_info: At which block did (or will) the fork happen?
coin.premine_info: Were coins sold or distributed before the public were able to participate in mining? Did the developers mine coins before telling anyone else about it? This is more of a "if it quacks like a duck it's probably a duck" question. For example Zcash has a 20% mining tax until the developers recieve 2,100,000 coins, thus their premine is 2100000.
coin.max_info: Is there a cap on the total number of coins produced? For example, Bitcoin is 21,000,000. If there's no cap. or if there's an inflationary tail, please input the total coins that will exist in the year 2050.
coin.git_info: This is the git code repository for the main node software (not the github organization). For example, Monero is https://github.com/monero-project/monero
coin.reddit_info: Is there a reddit page (subreddit) for this project?
coin.block_info: What is the block time for this blockchain?
coin.confirm_info: How many confirmations do exchanges wait for before they let you trade it if you deposit this currency? Not all exchanges are the same, but any number you've experienced yourself is fine.
coin.prev_info: Has this currency been known by any previous names?
coin.exchange_info: Which exchanges have listed this currency? Some examples include: Bittrex, Poloniex, Kraken
coin.funds_raised_prior: Funds were raised prior to the genesis block being mined (ICO)
coin.planned_ico: This is planned as an ICO
coin.btc_fork: This was a fork of the Bitcoin blockchain
coin.planned_fork: This is a planned fork of the Bitcoin blockchain
coin.time_remaining: You have %s minutes to complete the bounty for %s KZR.
